definition: to have friendly relationships/circle of friends
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]

sentences.english: The first part mainly introduces Cai Xiang's life experiences and excursion.
sentences.chinese: 第一部分介绍蔡襄的生平与交游。

sentences.english: Jeremy used to have a large circle of friends, but now he likes being alone.
sentences.chinese: 杰里米以前交游甚广，但现在他喜欢独处。

sentences.english: Among them, the second part is about the peregrination of Yang Shen in Yun nan.
sentences.chinese: 其中，第二部分专写杨慎的游历及交游情况。

sentences.english: Jeremy used to have a large circle of friends but now he likes being alone.
sentences.chinese: 杰里米以前交游甚广，但现在他喜欢独处。

sentences.english: The second chapter elaborates Wang Zao making friends and to its poetry creation influence.
sentences.chinese: 第二章论述汪藻的交游及对其诗歌创作的影响。

sentences.english: Chapter two will analyse and comment him on his behavior to make friends.
sentences.chinese: 第二章对李之仪的交游行为进行分析和评论。

sentences.english: Makes friends widely, was close with the literary arena relations then.
sentences.chinese: 交游广泛，与当时的文坛关系密切。

sentences.english: The second part is Wei Zhuang's social intercourse.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分为韦庄蜀中交游考。

sentences.english: He is a man of wide acquaintance.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个交游广阔的人。

sentences.english: These intercommunion activities improved the development in history and geography research on west part of China.
sentences.chinese: 这些学术交游活动，促进了西北史地研究的深入。

definition: to associate with/to mix with/to connect
friend from whom you can seek advice
